intro: [WRONG START] Walenia apiculata, commonly known as the spike-leaved daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers with yellow disc florets and white ray florets. The plant has a compact, bushy growth habit and thrives in well-drained sandy soils. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Wallenia apiculata is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
